plural noun.description: Melancholic music of black American folk origin, typically in a twelve-bar sequence. It developed in the rural southern US toward the end of the 19th century, finding a wider audience in the 1940s, as blacks migrated to the cities. This urban blues gave rise to rhythm and blues and rock and roll.
Feelings of melancholy, sadness, or depression.

origin: Mid 18th century (in blues (sense 2)): elliptically from blue devils depression or delirium tremens.
